terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.about-mereo.content1: Mereo is an experience and social platform that provides fans with various perks at all stages of an event. Mereo converges the offline and online experience of being a part of the fan community through our social platform and proprietary events.
terms.about-mereo.subcontent1: Ticketing: Manage event operations, sales & verification and distribution for offline & online events.
terms.about-mereo.subcontent2: Fan engagement: Get fans to engagement with the artist before and after the event.
terms.about-mereo.subcontent3: Rewards: Based on fan's engagement allow the artist to reward their top fans
terms.about-mereo.content3: Any works and associated Intellectual Property (IP) developed by Mereo is owned by Mereo. NFTs ownership grants the owner a perpetual licence granted by Mereo. Any resources available to Mereo are not beneficially received or owned by any person whilst those resources are contained in the Mereo wallet address, and members have no rights to an in-specie distribution of those resources or the proceeds from any sale of those resources during the life of Mereo or upon winding up of the Mereo.
terms.about-mereo.content4: Mereo comprises of the distributed ledger technology (DLT) contracts outlined in Clause 2, each of which are published under MIT License where Mereo is neither the author or copyright holder of the Software (as that term is defined under the MIT License) or works referenced by Software for which the IP is owned
terms.mereo-nft.subcontent1: The contract that is utilised for the creation and distribution of NFT Tickets upon purchase.
terms.mereo-nft.subcontent2: Mereo Ticketing Contract: to be advised.

terms.warning-and-risk.note: No Financial Advice: The information in this document is of a general nature and does not take into account your objectives, financial situation or particular needs.
terms.warning-and-risk.content1: There is one primary purpose of Mereo:
terms.warning-and-risk.subcontent1: to develop a social and engagement platform that provides fans with various perks at all stages of events through NFT ticketing.
terms.warning-and-risk.content2: In designing and developing social platform Mereo assumes that your participation in Mereo Activities is for your personal use and enjoyment rather than any commercial or investment purposes.
terms.warning-and-risk.content3: You should obtain your own independent advice and consider the appropriateness of Mereo NFTs, having regard to your personal circumstances, objectives, financial situation and needs, and legal and tax obligations.

terms.warning-and-risk.content6: At the date of publication of these Terms, the Mereo is not registrable nor a registered digital currency exchange provider or crypto (or virtual) asset service provider in any of the jurisdictions. Mereo is not regulated or actively supervised by any anti money laundering regulator in any jurisdiction.
terms.risks.content1: <bold>General:</bold> All activities involving tokens and NFTs carry risk. The appropriate level of risk for you may be dependent on your circumstances. Some key risks are outlined below:
terms.risks.subcontent1: <bold>Risk of decline in value of tokens:</bold> Mereo cannot guarantee the value of Mereo Tokens and NFTs at any time.
terms.risks.subcontent2: <bold>Market integrity risk:</bold> Mereo NFTs are capable of being freely traded but Mereo does not have the power to intervene. Accordingly, the price of Mereo NFTs will be subject to external market influence. The value of Mereo Tokens and NFTs will fluctuate and may fluctuate extremely. Their value may reduce to zero.
terms.risks.subcontent3: <bold>Financial risk:</bold> Mereo does not guarantee its ability to maintain a strong enough treasury to continue operations. There is a risk that the Mereo is not sufficiently responsive to changes in the industry, or cannot raise sufficient capital to continue operations.
terms.risks.subcontent4: <bold>Operational risk:</bold> Including, but not limited to, technology risk (i.e. DLTcontract vulnerabilities), reputational risk, fraud, compliance, outsourcing, business continuity planning, and legal risk.
terms.risks.subcontent5: <bold>Technology risk:</bold> Token and NFT activities carry the risks of interacting with Third-party Extensions and Third-party Platforms to participate in Mereo Activities. There is a risk that any Mereo Tokens and NFTs you acquire while participating with Mereo Activities could be stolen or exploited by a DLT contract vulnerability. You should also be wary of scams designed to convince you to sell or lend your Mereo NFTs, and should only engage with the Mereo and Mereo Activities in accordance with these Terms.
terms.risks.subcontent6: <bold>DLT contract risk:</bold> While the Mereo has taken steps to ensure the DLT contracts are safe and secure, there may be vulnerabilities in the suite of DLT contracts. These vulnerabilities could result in the loss of tokens other than just your Mereo Tokens, and could be related to other attacks to obtain your personal and sensitive information.
terms.risks.subcontent7: <bold>Custody risk:</bold> Mereo NFTs are tokens that are generally held in a self-hosted digital wallet or hardware wallet. Mereo NFTs rely on cryptography and technology such as blockchain for security and other features. There is no central authority for blockchain systems that collect identity information or that can recover lost or stolen tokens or private keys.
terms.risks.subcontent8: <bold>Regulatory risk:</bold> The legal and tax characterisation of Mereo and of NFT activities is uncertain and regulatory and policy efforts are evolving. It is your responsibility to ensure that your access and participation in Mereo Activities is lawful.
terms.risks.subcontent9: <bold>Tax treatment & policy environment:</bold> The tax treatment of token activities is uncertain. Tax authorities around the world are attempting to understand the technology, issue guidance to the public and consult on relevant necessary tax reform. The application of traditional tax principles to novel technology and NFT activities remains largely untested in court.
terms.risks.subcontent10: <bold>Phishing risk:</bold> Scammers may create phishing websites which pretend to be Mereo or involved in Mereo Activities. You are responsible for carefully checking that you are accessing the correct domain and application.

policy.4.8: post a review, rating, comment, or other user-generated content on one of our websites or applications; and
policy.4.9: invest in Mereo or enquire as to a potential investment or donation to support Mereo
policy.4.10: We may also collect Personal Information when we receive your Personal Information from third parties who legally provide it to us.

policy.5.1.1: enable you to access and use our Services and partake in Mereo Activities;
policy.5.1.2: to provide the Services and Mereo Activities to you and to improve the aforementioned;
policy.5.1.3: to operate, improve, and personalise the Services we offer, and to give each user a more consistent and personalised experience when interacting with us;

policy.10.1.1: A cookie is a small file containing a string of characters that is sent to your computer when you visit a website or use an online service. When you visit the website or use the service again, the cookie allows that website or online service to recognize your browser or device. Cookies may store unique identifiers, user preferences and other information.
policy.10.2.1: We may use “session cookies” or “persistent cookies.” Session cookies are temporary and expire once you close your browser or once your session ends. Persistent cookies remain on your device for much longer or until you or your browser erase them. Persistent cookies have varying durations that are dependent on their expiration date.
policy.10.3.1: Cookies help us improve the Service by providing us with information about which parts of the Service are most popular, enabling us to analyse technical and navigational information about the Service, and helping us to detect and prevent fraud. We also use cookies and other data collection tools (such as web beacons and server logs) to help improve your experience with the Service. For example, we use Google Analytics to help analyse how users use the Service. These tools use cookies to collect standard Internet log information and visitor behaviour information in an anonymous form. The information generated by the cookie about your use of the Service (including IP address) is transmitted to our data collection tool service providers. This information is then used by us to evaluate visitors’ use of the Service and to compile statistical reports on website activity for Mereo.If you would like to opt-out from the use of your information by Google analytics, you may use Google’s analytics opt-out browser add-on designed for this purpose.
policy.10.4.1: Web browsers allow some control of most cookies through the browser settings. To find out more about cookies, including how to manage and delete cookies, visit www.allaboutcookies.org. Some web browsers provide settings that allow a user to reject cookies or to alert a user when a cookie is placed on the user’s computer, tablet or mobile device. Most mobile devices also offer settings to reject mobile device identifiers. Although users are not required to accept cookies or mobile device identifiers, blocking or rejecting them may prevent access to some features available through the Service.

policy.14.2: Personal Information for the purpose of the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) means any information that identifies, relates to, describes or is capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with You. Under CCPA, personal information does not include: Publicly available information from government records, deidentified or aggregated consumer information, information excluded from the CCPA’s scope, such as health or medical information covered by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) and the California Confidentiality of Medical Information Act (CMIA) or clinical trial data Personal Information covered by certain sector-specific privacy laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FRCA), the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA) or California Financial Information Privacy Act (FIPA), and the Driver’s Privacy Protection Act of 1994.

policy.14.4: Consumer for the purpose of the CCPA means a natural person who is a California resident. A resident, as defined in the law, includes (1) every individual who is in California for other than a temporary or transitory purpose, and (2) every individual who is domiciled in the California who is outside California for a temporary or transitory purpose.
